intro: Panphalea cardaminifolia, commonly known as the yellow alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette and are usually covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Panphalea cardaminifolia is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy and often brightly colored flowers.
